page.title: 08Domesday Record 1086
page.content: This is an extract from the original {Domesday Book}on Clovelly. King William hath a manor called Cleavelieia which Bristic(Saxon Chief) held at the time of King Edward. It paid geld(tax) for 3 hides, these 12 ploughs(plough with 8 oxen) till. Thereof the King has 1 hide(120 acres) 5 ploughs in demesne (manor farm) and the villeins(tenant farmers) 2 hides and 7 ploughs. There the King has 16 villeins,11 bordars (smallholders), 10 serfs (slaves), 45 beasts(cattle), 15 swine, 100 sheep, 18 goats, 40 acres of wood, 30 of meadow and pasture, 1 league in length by half in breadth. The Manor pays Â£12. Goscelin (Norman Lord of the Manor) holds it at farm rent,which when he received it, it was paying Â£6.
